intro: Papaver pseudocanescens, commonly known as the pale sandpoppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes罂粟 (opium poppies) and other related species. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and have a distinctive, cup-like shape with reflexed petals. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in harsh environments.
